column4: i have a gtk theme folder, with the images and gtkrc file, how do i load it?
is it a tarball?
if so, you can just drag n drop it into the system -> preferences -> appearance thing
it isnt a tarball :( thats the problem
i have a folder with images, gtkrc and .rc files, how do i compile?
then drop the whole directory into ~/.themes, i think
no compiling involved
they're just config files.  they're read plaintext, like any other config file
~ means your home drive
i dont have that folder  think
anything starting with a dot is hidden
i put it in there but its not getting recognized by the Appearence dialog
how did you put it in?
mine has directories with the names of the themes
and inside each of those directories is the index.theme and a directory
pteeb ok thats in the right place
ah the index.theme is just a thing telling it what to show in the appearance dialog, i think
still its not there :(
the index.theme is in the folder, but its still not getting recognized by the dialog
.themes/ThemeName/index.theme ?
mind tryin it out? heh
er, i kinda got usurped by a friend whose windows ate her ubuntu partition
